qas.question: What practice is often used to bind different clans together?
According to a recent study, how many men of the Dhulbahante clan married women from the Hawiye clan?
According to a recent study, how many Dhulbahante men married women of a different Dhulbahante sub-clan?
To what clan family do the Ogaden belong?
What percentage of Dhulbahante men married women of the Majerteen or Ogaden?

context: Somali society is traditionally ethnically endogamous. So to extend ties of alliance, <a0_0>marriage<a0_0/> is often to another ethnic Somali from a different clan. Thus, for example, a recent study observed that in 89 marriages contracted by men of the Dhulbahante clan, <a2_0>55<a2_0/> (62%) were with women of Dhulbahante sub-clans other than those of their husbands; 30 (33.7%) were with women of surrounding clans of other clan families (Isaaq, 28; Hawiye, <a1_0>3<a1_0/>); and 3 (<a4_0>4.3%<a4_0/>) were with women of other clans of the <a3_0>Darod<a3_0/> clan family (Majerteen 2, Ogaden 1).
